H0.text: Bacteria are the most likely cause of tooth decay, an infection that causes deterioration of the protective enamel on teeth, resulting in damage.

H1.text: Acidic food is most likely the cause of tooth decay, an infection that causes deterioration of the protective enamel on teeth, resulting in damage.

H2.text: Allergies are the most likely cause of tooth decay, which is an infection that causes deterioration of the protective enamel on teeth, resulting in damage.

H3.text: Genetic defects are the most likely cause of tooth decay, an infection that causes deterioration of the protective enamel on teeth, resulting in damage.

A4.text: Tooth decay, also known as caries, is the breakdown of teeth due to acids produced by bacteria.

A5.text: In most people, disorders or diseases affecting teeth are not the primary cause of dental caries.
